meanings.definition: Fellahs (noun): plural form of fellah, meaning a peasant or agricultural laborer in the Middle East.
meanings.sent1: The fellahs worked hard in the fields under the hot sun.
meanings.sent2: The fellahs harvested the crops to feed their families.
meanings.sent3: The fellahs joked about their tired feet after a long day of farming.
meanings.sent4: The fellahs were the backbone of the rural community.
meanings.sent5: The image of the fellahs toiling in the fields stayed with him.

meanings.definition: Fellahs (verb): third person singular present of fellah, meaning to work as a peasant or agricultural laborer.
meanings.sent1: He fellahs in the fields every day to provide for his family.
meanings.sent2: She fellahs early in the morning before the sun rises.
meanings.sent3: The dog playfully fellahs around the garden, pretending to be a farmer.
meanings.sent4: Time fellahs forward as they labored in the fields.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the hoe fellahs through the quiet countryside.

meanings.definition: Fellahs (adjective): describing something related to or characteristic of peasants or agricultural laborers.
meanings.sent1: The village had a fellahs charm with its simple cottages and fields.
meanings.sent2: She wore a fellahs hat, reminiscent of the farmers in the countryside.
meanings.sent3: The fellahs festival celebrated the hard work of the local farmers.
meanings.sent4: His fellahs hands showed the signs of a life spent working the land.
meanings.sent5: The painting captured the fellahs spirit of the rural community.
